skill.name: code-explainer
skill.description: Explain complex code to team members in clear, understandable terms for effective knowledge shari...
skill.summary: Explain complex code to team members in clear, understandable terms for effective knowledge shari...
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown instructions for code explanation. No executable code, no file access, no network calls, no command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Complex code can confuse team members and slow onboarding. This skill generates easy-to-understand explanations with analogies, diagrams, and step-by-step breakdowns adapted to any audience level.
actual_capabilities: Generate high-level code overviews with purpose and system context
Create step-by-step execution walkthroughs with technical details
Build visual ASCII diagrams showing data flow and architecture
Adapt explanations for junior, mid-level, senior, or non-technical audiences
Provide analogies connecting code concepts to real-world scenarios
Include security notes, best practices, and common pitfalls
limitations: Does not execute or test code - only explains provided code snippets
Does not access external files or repositories directly
Cannot modify or refactor code - only describes it
Depends on user providing the code to be explained

use_cases.title: Accelerate team onboarding
use_cases.description: Help new developers understand legacy codebases faster with clear, structured explanations.

use_cases.title: Create documentation drafts
use_cases.description: Generate initial documentation drafts that can be refined into official guides and manuals.

use_cases.title: Mentor junior team members
use_cases.description: Provide consistent, detailed explanations that reinforce learning during code reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Code Explanation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @code-explainer to explain this code: [paste your code here]

prompt_templates.title: Visual Diagram
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @code-explainer --with-diagrams to visualize how this code works: [code]

prompt_templates.title: Step-by-Step
prompt_templates.prompt: Use @code-explainer --step-by-step to walk through this code line by line: [code]

output_examples.input: Explain this function: async function login(email, password) { const user = await User.findOne({ email }); const isValid = await bcrypt.compare(password, user.passwordHash); const token = jwt.sign({ userId: user.id }, process.env.JWT_SECRET); return { token, user: { id: user.id, email: user.email } }; }
output: PURPOSE: This function authenticates users by verifying credentials and returning a JWT token
STEP 1: Find user in database by email address
STEP 2: Compare provided password with stored hash using bcrypt
STEP 3: Generate signed JWT token with user ID payload
STEP 4: Return token and basic user info (excluding sensitive data)
KEY CONCEPT: The bcrypt comparison uses constant-time comparison to prevent timing attacks
REAL-WORLD ANALOGY: Like a hotel check-in - verifies your ID, gives you a key card (token) valid for your stay

best_practices: Provide the full context around the code snippet for more accurate explanations
Specify the audience level to get appropriately detailed explanations
Ask for diagrams when visualizing complex data flows or architecture
anti_patterns: Providing only isolated snippets without surrounding context
Expecting the skill to modify or refactor your code
Using for security-critical code without manual review of explanations

faq.question: Does this skill execute the code it explains?
faq.answer: No. The skill only generates text explanations. It does not run, test, or modify any code.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: All languages. The skill works with any programming language by analyzing the syntax and structure provided.

faq.question: Can I use this skill to document my entire codebase?
faq.answer: Provide code snippets or files piece by piece. The skill explains each section but does not scan directories.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external servers?
faq.answer: No. The skill runs entirely within your AI tool. Code is processed locally and never transmitted externally.

faq.question: Why are my explanations too basic or too advanced?
faq.answer: Use the --audience flag with junior, senior, or non-technical to adjust the explanation depth for your needs.

faq.question: How is this different from asking Claude directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured templates, visual diagrams, audience adaptation, and educational best practices consistently.
